description:
Version: Diablo 4
Hypervisor: LXC

When I restart Nova Compute with running instances, it wont start anymore but fail with this error:

2011-08-29 23:39:08,251 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=14961) execute /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/utils.py:164
2011-08-29 23:39:08,327 ERROR nova.exception [-] Uncaught exception
(nova.exception): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/exception.py", line 98, in wrapped
(nova.exception): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kw)
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1329, in update_available_resource
(nova.exception): TRACE:     return self.driver.update_available_resource(context, self.host)
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py", line 1499, in update_available_resource
(nova.exception): TRACE:     'vcpus_used': self.get_vcpu_used(),
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py", line 1328, in get_vcpu_used
(nova.exception): TRACE:     total += len(dom.vcpus()[1])
(nova.exception): TRACE: TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
(nova.exception): TRACE:
2011-08-29 23:39:08,328 CRITICAL nova [-] 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-compute", line 48, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     service.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 367, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     _launcher.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 107, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     service.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 166, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     return self._exit_event.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/event.py", line 116, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     return hubs.get_hub().switch()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 177, in switch
(nova): TRACE:     return self.greenlet.switch()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 192, in main
(nova): TRACE:     result = function(*args, **kwargs)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 77, in run_server
(nova): TRACE:     server.start()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 149, in start
(nova): TRACE:     self.manager.update_available_resource(ctxt)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/exception.py", line 129, in wrapped
(nova): TRACE:     raise Error(str(e))
(nova): TRACE: Error: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
(nova): TRACE:
title: Nova Compute does not restart when there are running instances

comments.content:
Version: Diablo 4
Hypervisor: LXC

When I restart Nova Compute with running instances, it wont start anymore but fail with this error:

2011-08-29 23:39:08,251 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=14961) execute /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/utils.py:164
2011-08-29 23:39:08,327 ERROR nova.exception [-] Uncaught exception
(nova.exception): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/exception.py", line 98, in wrapped
(nova.exception): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kw)
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1329, in update_available_resource
(nova.exception): TRACE:     return self.driver.update_available_resource(context, self.host)
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py", line 1499, in update_available_resource
(nova.exception): TRACE:     'vcpus_used': self.get_vcpu_used(),
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py", line 1328, in get_vcpu_used
(nova.exception): TRACE:     total += len(dom.vcpus()[1])
(nova.exception): TRACE: TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
(nova.exception): TRACE: 
2011-08-29 23:39:08,328 CRITICAL nova [-] 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-compute", line 48, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     service.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 367, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     _launcher.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 107, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     service.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 166, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     return self._exit_event.wait()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/event.py", line 116, in wait
(nova): TRACE:     return hubs.get_hub().switch()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 177, in switch
(nova): TRACE:     return self.greenlet.switch()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 192, in main
(nova): TRACE:     result = function(*args, **kwargs)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 77, in run_server
(nova): TRACE:     server.start()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/service.py", line 149, in start
(nova): TRACE:     self.manager.update_available_resource(ctxt)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/exception.py", line 129, in wrapped
(nova): TRACE:     raise Error(str(e))
(nova): TRACE: Error: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
(nova): TRACE:
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bas-t

comments.content: This bug is open for quite a while already. Any pointers on how to fix this?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bas-t

comments.content: Nobody? This seems like quite a big issue to me...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bas-t

comments.content: Any idea if this is LXC-specific ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Maybe you could test the return value of dom.vcpus() and set the vcpu to 0 on NoneType.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~patrick-hetu

comments.content:
duplicate of
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/903943,

which has been fixed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudayou
